awards.title: Student Inspiration Award 2015
awards.description: The Student Inspiration Award is an annual award, handed out to students or alumni of the TU Delft that delivered an outstanding performance during or after their studies. A performance that can inspire current students based on research, innovation, entrepreneurship (with a social impact) or study-results.

awards.title: Creating Sustainable Cities: Best project award
awards.description:
The prize was given based on market pull, uniqueness of innovation, scalability and replicability, strength of the business model, regulatory feasibility and technical feasibility, climate impact & co‐benefits (deriving from initial climate impact e.g. health, education, community, social etc.). 
Our project “Light up the neighborhood” improves people’s quality of life by increasing safety, services and community engagement in the neighbourhood.

awards.title: Finalist at the Energy Startups Pitch Event at the Energy Convention 2014
awards.description: The Energy Startup Pitch Event is part of the Innovation in Energy theme, which addresses the need for innovative new energy sources. The Energy Convention is the largest energy-related event in the Northern part of The Netherlands.

awards.title: 3rd place Solar Decathlon Europe 2014 (Team Project)
Best Paper Award Finalist
awards.description:
For the honours course "Critical Reflection on Technology" each student had to write an individual paper, presenting and defending it during a debate at the end of the course.
The aim of the course was to assess the ability to form an independent, well argued position with regards to ethical and methodological problems that concern the professional practice of engineers. 
4 students were selected for the final debated and the award was issued by two prominent jury members of Delft University of Technology and one philosophy lecturer.

projects.title: Light Up the Neighbourhood
projects.description: Light UP is designed to improve the quality of citizens’ life by revitalizing neglected or otherwise unattractive areas through refurbishing properties and plots. Collecting the needs of the communities by directly involving them, abandoned or misused buildings are identified based on opportunities foreseen for interested investors. A net zero energy design is then proposed to municipalities, citizens and investors, bringing functions which that particular area needs and wants. The conversion of the area is designed to be a learning process for inhabitants, who are given the function they asked for with high standards of sustainability and are educated about a sustainable lifestyle in the process. Light UP works with the objectives of the municipality but the power of private developers, filling the existing gap among citizens, public and private sectors.

projects.title: StreetLight Evolution
projects.description:
Streetlight Evolution is all about attention. Attention for the beauty of everyday items that usually go unnoticed, such as street lights. Attention for their history. Attention for the engineers behind them. The street lights are placed in a bouquet formation, which makes the lightposts put each other in the spotlight. This invites the spectator to look at the light posts, instead of merely their gleam. The artwork will be interactive to keep the spectator's attention even longer

Street Light Evolution is a collaboration between ten Honours Students from the Delft University of Technology, led by Koen Fraijman. The students are realising this project in three months, besides their regular curriculum.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor @TUDelft in Future-proof Innovation Management

projects.title: Creating the business case for the zero-energy refurbishment of commercial buildings
projects.description:
Through the analysis of case studies, interviews to relevant stakeholders, among which real estate investors, this research project identified the financial and technical barriers encountered today to undertake deep energy retrofit. Subsequently, the design interventions needed to refurbish a Dutch office building and meeting the net zero energy target were evaluated using a software complying with the Dutch standards NEN 7120 (ENORM). A risk and sensitivity analysis, with Monte Carlo simulations, showed the influence that some design aspects, energy price and landlord-tenant agreements have on the business case. Finally a number of strategies are suggested in order to increase financial benefits for the building owners who invest in zero energy refurbishment. 
This research also provides developers with a checklist assessing the potentials for existing buildings to procure an attractive business case.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor @TUDelft in Future-proof Innovation Management

projects.title: Double Curved Concrete Panels for a Tulip shaped Pavilion
projects.description:
Double curved concrete panels are an attractive option for free form architecture with complex geometry. Still its manufacturing and technology presents many challenges. Ir Roel Schipper works with his PhD on the optimisation of this technology: the Flexible Mould Project. As a contribution to this project we had the opportunity to design a Tulip shaped pavilion for the campus of TU Delft using this complex technology. After the design of the pavilion, we performed the casting, deforming and demoulding of the double curved elements which were part of our facade design.
The panels were manufactured using the improved version of the flexible mould designed by Ir. Peter Eigenraam.

More info on the Flexible Mould Project:
http://homepage.tudelft.nl/6w3a0/FlexibleMouldProject.htm

To see the casted panels:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4IA8yMAaGIU&feature=youtu.be

projects.title: BSc graduation project - Theoretical and experimental analysis of sound production and propagation of the harp.
projects.description:
A practical way to apply acoustical principles, usually studied and analyzed for concert halls, to the sound box of a harp. The research project had the objective of identifying geometrical and structural parameters that play a major role in the musical instrument acoustical performances. 

Researches and experiments had been carried out on different harps under the supervision of Rosario Aniello Romano Professor of the Energy and Applied Thermo-fluid Dynamics department.

profile_positions.description:
- Organizer and manager of the Sustainability Salons. The Sustainability Salon is a community of over 400 business sustainability scholars located around the globe that meets quarterly to share research.
- Researcher and curriculum designer for the Innovation Learning Labs. The innovation Learning Lab is an initiative that brings together organizations, scholars, and students to re-innovate the innovation process so that it creates value for society and organizations simultaneously.

profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher at the Centre for Sustainable Entrepreneurship

profile_positions.description: Our motto: Improve your house, preserve your home. Prêt-à-Loger proudly presents a solution for 1.4 million energy consuming Dutch row houses from around 1960. By putting a Skin (that's how we call our toolbox) over the house, it becomes energy neutral and more space is added, while the quality of a home remains preserved. Visit our website to know more! http://www.pretaloger.nl

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Scientific Advisory Board
Memeber of the committee of representative of the ECOYR - Energy Community of Young Researcher
volunteer_experiences.description: New Energy Coalition is a knowledge and network organisation striving for a sustainable world by boosting the acceleration of the energy transition. This system transformation requires business enterprises, (knowledge) institutes and policy makers to innovate in close collaboration in order to achieve breakthroughs in technology and knowledge, in economic and societal implementations and in people’s mindset and behaviour. As a catalyst, New Energy Coalition drives innovation and education by bringing together knowledge, policy and entrepreneurship.

company.name: The world in your classroom - Den Haag

volunteer_experiences.description: Thanks to the project ‘The World in your Classroom’ internationals living in the Hague, volunteer their time to give guest lectures in English, French or German to Dutch high school students, teaching them about various aspects of their home countries such as: culture, economy, current affairs, history and geography. The students open to intercultural communication and cultural differences while practicing other languages.
